docs.title: Welcome to Computers West
docs.text:
Located at Palm Ridge Recreation Center.

We empower our members by elevating their computer understanding, smartphone abilities, and Internet-of-Things (IoT) savvy. Explore technology support & repair, special interest groups, and classes.

Free high-speed Internet for Sun City West residents is offered in the Palm Ridge Recreation Center lobby (for club members and accompanied guests).

docs.title: Quick Links
docs.text: New Member Orientation & Monitor Training Monitor Signup Monitoring Manual

docs.title: Club Information
docs.text:
Location

Palm Ridge Center West Deer Valley Drive Sun City West, AZ 85375 (623) 214-1546

Club Hours

Normal: Mon–Fri 8:00am–4:00pm Summer: Mon, Tue & Thu 10:00am–2:00pm; Wed & Fri 7:30am–2:00pm

docs.title: Pay Dues
docs.text:
Pay dues online (current year link maintained on the website).

  • Pay Dues: https://computerswest.org/pay-dues-2025/

docs.title: Cell Phones for Soldiers
docs.text:
Computers West sponsors Cell Phones for Soldiers. Each contribution to Cell Phones For Soldiers provides military members with precious talk time through our Minutes That Matter program, and it gives each qualified veteran a cellular device to assist with employment, contacting loved ones and communicating with veteran resources.

Cell Phones for Soldiers was started by Brittany and Robbie Bergquist in 2004 when they heard of a soldier having a high phone bill from calling home. What started with raiding their piggy banks has grown into a nationwide cause. Our quest continues. Continue donating your old phones and pass the word! It’s one way to say Thank You to the men and women who continue to give so much to our country.

Our Cell Phones for Soldiers box is in the main room by the printer.

docs.title: History of Computers West
docs.text:
Computers West began in 1984 when seven Sun City West residents organized a club to help seniors learn emerging computer technology. Monthly meetings, user groups, and classes quickly followed as membership grew (over 2,700 by 2001).

Through the years, the club:

  • Established permanent facilities across Rec Centers, ultimately moving to Palm Ridge.
  • Ran free/low‑cost lectures and hands‑on classes (dozens per year).
  • Operated a Help Group that has saved members significant repair costs.
  • Donated equipment and supported local schools, hospitals, food banks, and programs such as Students Recycling Used Technology (RUT).
  • Collected thousands of devices for Cell Phones for Soldiers and other community drives.

The club remains true to its purpose: “Technology Has No Age Limit.”

docs.title: Classes FAQs
docs.text: Answers to common questions about registration, refunds, waitlists, class requirements, materials, and more.

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
• How do I register?
  • Register online through the Classes page or in person at the club during open hours. Most classes require advance registration and space is limited.
  • Do I need to be a member to register?
  • Some classes are open to the public; others require club membership. Check the individual class listing for eligibility.

docs.title: Payments
docs.text:
• What forms of payment are accepted?
  • Payments are accepted online (credit/debit) and in person at the club. See the class listing for any specific payment instructions.
  • When is payment due?
  • Payment is typically due at the time of registration to hold your seat.

docs.title: Waitlist
docs.text:
• What happens if a class is full?
  • You may join the waitlist. If a seat becomes available, staff will notify waitlisted participants in date/time order.
  • Is there a charge to join the waitlist?
  • No charge to join the waitlist. Payment is only collected if/when you are enrolled.

docs.title: Refunds & Transfers
docs.text:
• What is the refund policy?
  • Refund and transfer policies are listed on each class description. Generally, full or partial refunds may be available if cancellation is requested before a specified deadline.
  • Can I transfer to a different session?
  • Transfers between sessions may be allowed subject to availability and cutoff dates. Contact staff to request a transfer.

docs.title: Class Requirements & Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Are prerequisites required?
  • Many classes list prerequisites. Please confirm you meet any stated requirements before registering.
  • What experience level is required?
  • Class listings indicate the intended level (beginner, intermediate, advanced). Choose classes aligned with your skill level.

docs.title: Materials & Software
docs.text:
• Do I need to bring anything?
  • Class listings specify required materials, supplies, or software. Some classes provide handouts; others expect students to bring a laptop.
  • Is software provided?
  • In-class computers may have necessary software installed for the session. If you use your own device, ensure required software is installed before class.

docs.title: Attendance & Cancellations
docs.text:
• What if I miss a class?
  • Attendance policies vary. Some classes do not prorate for missed sessions. Contact the instructor if you have special circumstances.
  • Will the class be canceled if too few students register?
  • Yes. Classes may be canceled for low enrollment; registered students will be notified and offered a refund or transfer.

docs.title: Class Size, Duration & Format
docs.text:
• How large are classes?
  • Class sizes are listed with each course. Smaller classes are used for hands-on instruction; lecture-style classes may be larger.
  • How long are classes?
  • Session lengths are indicated in the class description (e.g., 2-hour single session, multi-week series).
  • Are classes offered online?
  • Some classes may be offered remotely or as hybrid sessions. See the listing for delivery format.

docs.title: Certificates & Completion
docs.text:
• Will I get a certificate?
  • Some courses provide a certificate of completion. Check the specific class details.

docs.title: Accessibility & Special Needs
docs.text:
• How do I request accommodations?
  • Contact the club staff before the class so accommodations can be arranged whenever possible.
  • Is the facility accessible?
  • The Palm Ridge facility is accessible. If you need additional accommodations, inform staff in advance.

docs.title: Recording & Privacy
docs.text:
• Can classes be recorded?
  • Recording policies vary by instructor and class. Obtain permission before recording. Respect other participants' privacy.

docs.title: Policies & Conduct
docs.text:
• What behavior is expected?
  • Professional, respectful conduct is required. Disruptive behavior may result in removal from a class without refund.

docs.title: Questions & Contact
docs.text:
• Where can I get help?
  • For class-specific questions, see the class listing or contact club staff at the front desk during club hours or through the contact method listed on the Classes page.

docs.title: Updates & Notifications
docs.text:
• How will I be notified of changes?
  • Registered students will receive email notifications for cancellations, rescheduling, or important updates.

docs.title: Classes Overview
docs.text:
Computers West offers lectures and hands‑on classes spanning computer basics, productivity, apps, smartphones, and more. Some classes are free; hands‑on classes may charge a small fee to cover program costs.

See also the Registration page for how to enroll and payment details.

docs.title: Classes offered (summary)
docs.text: Beginner and introductory computer classes (computer basics, using a mouse and keyboard) Windows operating system classes (Windows 10/11 basics and intermediate topics) macOS and Apple device classes (Mac basics and macOS features) iPhone and iPad (iOS) usage and tips Android phone and tablet usage Internet, web browsing, and email fundamentals Office applications: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Google Workspace basics Digital photography and photo editing Video streaming and cord-cutting topics Internet security, privacy, and safe computing File management, backups, and cloud services (Dropbox, Google Drive) Smart devices, home networking, and Wi-Fi basics Specialized workshops and labs (genealogy, digital hobbies, small-group help) Advanced topics (basic programming, databases, troubleshooting)

docs.title: Membership
docs.text: Computers West is a chartered club of the Recreation Centers of Sun City West (RCSCW). Membership provides access to facilities, classes, SIGs, and technology support/repair. If your contact info changes or you’re not receiving newsletters, please update your information (see Newsletters).

docs.title: Bylaws
docs.text:
Computers West bylaws are published as a PDF.

  • Download the bylaws (PDF): https://computerswest.org/wp-content/uploads/2023/02/2022Computer-West-Bylaws-2022.pdf

docs.title: Meeting Minutes
docs.text:
Minutes are available by date and meeting type. Use the online table to search or sort by month, year, or type (Board/General).

  • Minutes archive: https://computerswest.org/minutes-2/

docs.title: Newsletters
docs.text:
We email newsletters to keep members up‑to‑date on club activities. If you are not receiving the current newsletter, please ensure your membership is in good standing and check your email spam folder.

Update your contact information or subscribe

Subscribe or update

Use the link above to open the official newsletter signup/update form. The form collects contact details, membership status, subscription preferences, and consent.

docs.title: Computers West Officers
docs.text: The Officers meet monthly from September through May. All members are welcome to attend.

docs.title: Voting Officers
docs.text:
• President: Norm Falcone
  • Vice President: Angelo Petraca
  • Secretary: Jim Humphrey
  • Treasurer: Karen Flores
  • Past President: Patrick Kenevan
  • Windows and PC Repair: Bob Gasner
  • All Things Apple: Bruce Merrihew

To contact officers, use the club email links provided on the website.

docs.title: Other Officers
docs.text:
• Membership: Vacant (contact the President if interested)
  • Monitor/Orientation Coordinator: Vacant (contact the President if interested)
  • Publicity: Linda Victor

  • Events Manager: Vacant

docs.title: Monitor Duties
docs.text:
Monitors greet members, manage sign‑ins, assist with basic facility needs, and help keep labs ready for classes and support sessions. Please review the full duties and procedures before your shift.

  • Full monitor duties: https://computerswest.org/monitor-duties/

docs.title: Monitoring Manual
docs.text:
The Monitoring Manual provides detailed procedures, checklists, and policies for running a shift.

  • Monitoring Manual: https://computerswest.org/monitoring-manual/

docs.title: Monitor Signup
docs.text:
Monitors keep the club open and running smoothly. Sign up online for available shifts.

We appreciate your help to keep the club open. We need 2 monitors per 4 hour shift.

Winter Shift Times

September through May 8am – 12pm and 12pm – 4pm

Summer Shift Times

June, July, and August 10am – 2pm

If you are new or need a refresher, please check out Monitor Duties on this website.

Monitor SignUp

docs.title: Monitor Training & New Member Orientation
docs.text:
New members and prospective monitors should attend orientation/training to learn how the club operates, policies, and how to assist members during open hours.

  • Orientation & training info: https://computerswest.org/monitor-training-2/

docs.title: 3D Printing Special Interest Group (SIG)
docs.text: Explore the world of 3D printing, from design to fabrication, and share knowledge on best practices and innovations in the field.

docs.title: SIG Meetings
docs.text:
• Regular meeting times and location are listed on the club calendar. Check the club site or SIG board for the next session and presentation topic.
  • Meetings typically include demonstrations, member Q&A, and hands‑on help.

docs.title: Artificial Intelligence Special Interest Group
docs.text: Discuss and learn about practical AI tools and methods for everyday computing.

docs.title: All Things Apple
docs.text: A group for Mac, iPhone, and iPad users to explore features, solve problems, and share best practices.

docs.title: Flight Simulator Special Interest Group
docs.text: Enthusiasts share setups, add‑ons, and flying techniques for popular simulator platforms.

docs.title: Genealogy Special Interest Group
docs.text: Thursdays 10:00 am–12:00 pm in Room B. Get help with Ancestry, FamilySearch, Relative Finder, and more.

docs.title: Open Systems (Linux) Special Interest Group
docs.text: Explore free and privacy‑friendly alternatives to paid, closed systems. Topics include Linux distros, LibreOffice, browsers, and open‑source apps.

docs.title: Special Interest Groups (SIGs)
docs.text:
Computers West provides a number of Special Interest groups (SIGs).

SIGs are self-organizing groups focused on specific topics, technologies, or activities.

docs.title: Streaming & Cord‑Cutting SIG
docs.text: Learn how to replace or augment traditional TV service with streaming, over‑the‑air reception, and simple home setups. This SIG covers device choices, service options, antenna basics, privacy and cost‑saving tips.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
This Special Interest Group (SIG) helps members choose and configure streaming devices and services, combine them with free over‑the‑air (OTA) TV where appropriate, and troubleshoot common issues like buffering, account management, and smart TV settings.

What we cover

  • Choosing streaming devices: Roku, Apple TV, Amazon Fire TV, Android TV / Google TV, Chromecast.
  • Streaming services: free ad‑supported and paid subscription options.
  • OTA TV: antennas, tuners, and DVR options.
  • Network basics: Wi‑Fi setup, Ethernet, router placement, and QoS.
  • Privacy & security tips for streaming devices and accounts.

docs.title: SIG Meetings
docs.text:
• Regular meeting times and location are listed on the club calendar. Check the club site or SIG board for the next session and presentation topic.
  • Meetings typically include demonstrations, member Q&A, and hands‑on help.

docs.title: Streaming players
docs.text:
• Roku: simple interface, broad app support, good for users wanting minimal setup.
  • Amazon Fire TV: tight Amazon integration, good for Prime customers.
  • Apple TV: best for Apple ecosystem users; supports AirPlay.
  • Android TV / Google TV: integrates with Google services and Chromecast.
  • Chromecast: lightweight option for casting from phones and Chrome browser.

docs.title: Smart TVs
docs.text:
• Many smart TVs have built‑in platforms; evaluate app availability and update policy before buying.
  • Consider using an external streaming stick/player to avoid manufacturer bloatware and for more consistent updates.

docs.title: Antennas & OTA
docs.text:
• Use an indoor or outdoor antenna with adequate gain for your area. AntennaWeb or FCC TV Reception Maps help determine signal strength.
  • Tuners and OTA DVRs (e.g., Tablo, HDHomeRun) allow recording and streaming across home devices.

docs.title: Free options
docs.text:
• Free ad‑supported streaming (FAST) services: Pluto TV, Tubi, Peacock (free tier), Crackle, etc.
  • Network apps may offer free episodes or limited streaming.

docs.title: Paid subscriptions
docs.text:
• Streaming services: Netflix, Hulu, Disney+, Amazon Prime Video, Max, Paramount+, Apple TV+.
  • Consider rotating subscriptions and shared profiles to manage cost.

docs.title: Add‑ons & niche services
docs.text: • Sports packages, premium channels, and specialty apps are available à la carte.

docs.title: Network & Performance Tips
docs.text:
• Prefer wired Ethernet for primary streaming devices when possible.
  • For Wi‑Fi: place the router centrally, use 5 GHz for device support, and minimize interference.
  • If many devices stream simultaneously, consider upgrading bandwidth or enabling router QoS.
  • Clear app caches and keep device firmware updated to reduce performance issues.

docs.title: Setup Checklist
docs.text:
1. Choose a primary streaming device or smart TV.
  2. Confirm required apps/services are available on that device.
  3. Measure Wi‑Fi signal or connect via Ethernet.
  4. For OTA TV: check antenna direction, mounting height, and use a signal amplifier if needed.
  5. Create or sign in to streaming accounts and set up parental controls as needed.
  6. Test playback and adjust picture/HDMI settings for best quality.

docs.title: Privacy \& Account Safety
docs.text:
• Use strong, unique passwords and enable two‑factor authentication when available.
  • Review device privacy settings (voice assistants, viewing history, ad personalization).
  • Be cautious when granting app permissions.

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text:
• Reboot modem/router and streaming device as a first step.
  • Check for outages with your ISP or with a specific streaming service.
  • Reduce stream quality temporarily if buffering persists.
  • Update the app and device firmware; reinstall the app if problems persist.

docs.title: Resources
docs.text:
• FCC TV Reception Maps: https://www.fcc.gov/media/television/overview
  • AntennaWeb: https://www.antennasdirect.com/antennaweb
  • Manufacturer support pages for Roku, Apple, Amazon, Google, Samsung, LG

docs.title: Local Help & Contact
docs.text:
• SIG volunteers provide in‑person help during SIG hours. Check the club calendar or contact the front desk for scheduling.
  • For purchases and hands‑on assistance, bring the device and account credentials (if comfortable).

docs.title: Video Hangouts Special Interest Group
docs.text: Meet to discuss and practice video conferencing tools, streaming, and related topics.

docs.title: PC Windows Special Interest Group
docs.text: A group for Windows users focusing on tips, troubleshooting, and getting more from Windows PCs.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Volunteers provide hands‑on help for a wide range of personal computing and device issues. Support is offered on a first‑come, first‑served basis during scheduled sessions. For complex repairs or parts replacements volunteers may need to retain a device for further diagnosis or order parts.

docs.title: Services commonly provided
docs.text:
• Device diagnosis and basic repairs
  • Data backup and transfer
  • Malware detection and cleanup
  • Performance upgrades (for example, SSD installs)
  • Application help and configuration
  • Email client migrations (e.g., Cox to Outlook, Thunderbird, Yahoo)
  • Advice on peripherals, printers, and network connectivity

docs.title: PC & Android Support and Repair
docs.text:
• Wednesdays and Fridays, starting 7:30 am (first‑come, first‑served).
  • Please sign in by 8:30 am to retain your place in line.
  • Typical help includes the items listed above; some issues may require follow‑up work.

docs.title: Apple Support Session
docs.text:
• Wednesdays, 10:00 am–12:00 pm (Room C) — volunteers assist with Mac, iPhone, and iPad basics.
  • Always bring your Apple ID \& password if account access is needed.

docs.title: What to bring
docs.text:
• Your device and any required power/connection cables
  • Account credentials (bring them securely)
  • A recent backup of your personal data, if possible
  • Notes about the problem or error messages observed

docs.title: Drop‑off, parts, and fees
docs.text:
• Some repairs require parts or additional labor; volunteers will advise on cost and options.
  • Service is free to members who meet the monitoring requirement. For non‑member policies or fees, contact the front desk.

docs.title: Data, privacy & liability
docs.text:
• Staff and volunteers work to protect privacy but members are responsible for their data and backups.
  • Sensitive passwords or account information should be handled carefully; volunteers may ask you to perform account sign‑ins yourself when feasible.

docs.title: How to get help
docs.text:
• Check the club calendar or SIG announcements for schedule changes and special sessions.
  • Sign in at the tech support desk when sessions are open; staff at the front desk can provide current hours and any appointment information.

docs.title: Volunteer monitors
docs.text:
• Monitoring supports the club and helps maintain eligibility for free services. Ask staff how to schedule or record your monitoring shift.

Questions

For specific questions about procedures, parts, or service eligibility, contact the front desk during club hours or consult the club calendar.
